examples: she was now a mature woman

definitions.definition: having reached an advanced stage of mental or emotional development characteristic of an adult.
examples: comparative adjective: maturer; superlative adjective: maturest

definitions.definition: (of thought or planning) careful and thorough.
examples: on mature reflection he decided they should not go

definitions.definition: used euphemistically to describe someone as being middle-aged or old.
examples: Miss Walker was a mature lady when she married

definitions.definition: (of certain foodstuffs or drinks) ready for consumption.
examples: ripe, ripened, mellow; ready to eat/drink mature cheese

definitions.definition: denoting an economy, industry, or market that has developed to a point where substantial expansion and investment no longer takes place.

synonyms: reach maturity "kittens mature when they are about a year old"develop
thrive "their friendship didn't have time to mature"

definitions.definition: (of a person) reach an advanced stage of mental or emotional development.
examples: men mature as they grow older
synonyms: become more adult; blossom "he's matured since he left home"

definitions.definition: (with reference to certain foodstuffs or drinks) become or cause to become ready for consumption.
synonyms: mellow; age "leave the cheese to mature"

definitions.definition: (of an insurance policy, security, etc.) reach the end of its term and hence become payable.
